myBestAuntieDescription.title: What Do You Get in the My Best Auntie Training Course?

items.title: Live Practice Training
items.description: Interactive sessions where aunties role-play common toddler moments and practice calm, Montessori-aligned responses.

items.title: Post-Course Auntie Review
items.description: A structured follow-up review to refine techniques, troubleshoot daily friction points, and reinforce consistency.

items.title: Family Routine Workbook
items.description: Ready-to-use checklists, scripts, and routine templates that make daily caregiving easier to run at home.

items.title: Home Setup Walkthrough
items.description: A practical home setup guide that helps aunties prepare clear play, sleep, and transition spaces for better flow.

items.title: Communication Scripts Toolkit
items.description: Simple scripts for transitions, boundaries, and emotional coaching so aunties can respond with clarity and confidence.

items.title: Confidence Booster Coaching
items.description: Focused coaching touchpoints that keep implementation on track and help aunties stay steady as children grow.

resources.title: Free Resources for Gentle Parenting
resources.description: Access our library of free learning materials.
resources.cardTitle: Free Guide: 4 Simple Ways to Teach Patience to Young Children

items: The ‚ÄúFirst‚Ä¶Then‚Äù Trick: Links waiting to a clear, concrete action.
Make Time Visible: Use a visual timer for results.
Stay Consistent: Set 2-3 non-negotiable waits daily.

courseHighlights.title: Why Join Our Courses
courseHighlights.description: The program serious families choose when they want real change

items.title: Calm Is Built, Not Hoped For
items.description: Children are not "naturally difficult." Chaos comes from unclear guidance and inconsistent adults. We train aunties to build calm through structure, limits, and preparation.

items.title: Your Auntie Is a Daily Educator
items.description: Whether trained or not, your auntie is shaping your child every day. We ensure she models independence, respect, and emotional regulation ‚Äî not control or passivity.

items.title: Security Alone Creates Dependence
items.description: Comfort without limits creates reliance, not confidence. Children need clear boundaries, responsibility, and expectations to grow. We teach aunties how to provide all three.

items.title: We Work Where Problems Actually Happen
items.description: Courses fail when they stay theoretical. We observe your child in your home, during real routines and real stress ‚Äî and intervene with precision.

items.title: Progress Must Be Visible
items.description: If nothing changes, training failed. Our families see measurable shifts in behavior, routines, and atmosphere ‚Äî tracked weekly and reviewed together.

items.title: Alignment Is Non-Negotiable
items.description: When parents and aunties are misaligned, children suffer. We work with both ‚Äî so guidance is consistent, fair, and predictable.

testimonials.title: Real Stories from Parents in Hong Kong

items.quote: Ida was fantastic, she helped me understand how I could set up my home in a Montessori way without disrupting my style.
items.author: Mary Lo

items.quote: Taking part in the toddler healthy eating course was such a rewarding experience for me and my fellow mom friends! Ida's passion for child development and happiness truly shone through, and her expertise in Montessori principles made the strategies practical and easy to implement. I left feeling confident and inspired to create healthy, enjoyable mealtime routines for my child. Thank you, Ida!!
items.author: Yen

items.quote: Thank you so much for bringing jenelyn to another level ü§£ü§£ü§£ I can see her improvement after joining the course. To be honest, that isn‚Äôt easy but I see her changes üôèüèªüôèüèªüôèüèªthanks so much!
items.author: Sarah

items.quote: My aunties came back very excited and motivated! I‚Äôm already seeing more awareness of the language Lizel is using as well as approach to toddler outbursts (if we want kids to use polite language, we must demonstrate & utilise it ourselves!)
items.author: Gabriella

items.quote: The seminar talks about how to support our baby to build a healthy relationship with food, and to create a good experience with mealtime for both baby and the caregiver. I feel positive to try these new ways to build many meaningful dining experience with my baby ‚ù§Ô∏è
items.author: Yana

items.quote: Hello Ida, my auntie Cristine recently completed your pilot programme for 0-12 month! Thank you so much for this wonderful course. It's given her lots of fantastic ideas which we've been implementing! The course notes were very helpful, as it allowed us parents to learn things too (we're first time parents so every day is a school day!)
items.author: Emma

items.quote: Thanks Ida for the class, we can really see the changes from Emely!
items.author: Joyce

items.quote: Hi! My auntie attended the course and came back with real life understanding of how to raise an independent calm toddler. I have also worked with Ida on a professional level creating a workshop we've created together on raising independent intuitive eaters and both experiences have been great. Would recommend! (My auntie herself loved the experience too, there is no other place for them to connect and ask questions about how to raise children and communicate with their employers so this was really great for us!)
items.author: Mira

ida.title: Hello, fellow parents!
ida.subtitle: My name is Ida, founder of Evolve Sprouts-and above all, a mum navigating the same joys and challenges you are.
ida.description: I am a mother to two bright sparks: Mia, my spirited 5-year-old, and Eva, our miracle.

myHistory.title: A Brief History: From Passion to Purpose
myHistory.subtitle: Like many of you, my path has not been linear.
myHistory.description: I started my career in media and communication, working in hospitality across the UK and Hong Kong. Four years ago, I made a leap of faith and left my corporate role to pursue my deepest passion: reimagining education.

myJourney.title: My Montessori Journey: A Parent's Transformation

cards.description: Seeing my children blossom into curious, confident little humans-capable of pouring their own water, resolving conflicts with kindness, and embracing mistakes as part of learning-opened my eyes. But this journey was not without struggles.

My true Montessori journey began at home. As a mother to Mia and Eva, I witnessed something extraordinary: respect, independence, and child-led learning did not just shape their growth-they transformed mine.

whyUs.title: Why Evolve Sprouts Exists: You're Not Alone
introItems: It is hard to drown out the noise of comparison.
It is hard to trust your instincts when the world says: Hurry up.
It is hard to create calm in Hong Kong's relentless pace.
whyUs.communityText: That is why Evolve Sprouts is not just about workshops-it is about building a community for parents like you and me.

pillars.title: Training Course for your Auntie
pillars.description: Ensure your children grow up with your values and principles by training your auntie with our specialised course for Hong Kong families.

pillars.title: Practical Tools
pillars.description: From small-space Montessori setups to real-life scripts for difficult moments, you will leave with clear actions you can apply immediately.

pillars.title: Emotional Support
pillars.description: A safe and non-judgmental space to share struggles, ask questions, and feel seen.

pillars.title: Shared Learning
pillars.description: Stories and strategies from families walking this same path-messy moments and all.

faq.title: Everything You Need to Know
faq.emptySearchResultsLabel: No matching questions found. Please try another keyword.

questions.question: We live in a small apartment. Will this still work?
questions.answer: Yes. Most Hong Kong families do, and so do I. We specialise in small-space Montessori setups, shared rooms, and practical routines that do not require expensive materials or furniture.

questions.question: Do I need to follow Montessori perfectly to work with you?
questions.answer: No. This is Montessori-informed, not Montessori-dogmatic. We focus on principles that improve daily life: independence, respect, consistency, and emotional regulation-adapted to modern Hong Kong homes and caregiving realities.

questions.question: Who is Evolve Sprouts for?
questions.answer: Evolve Sprouts supports families in Hong Kong with children aged 0-6, especially those working with helpers or navigating busy city life.

questions.question: How is Montessori relevant for infants and toddlers at home?
questions.answer: Montessori is not just for classrooms. We teach aunties to create child-friendly home environments and practical routines that build independence from infancy.

questions.question: What is the difference between positive discipline and regular discipline?
questions.answer: Traditional discipline often relies on rewards and punishments. Positive discipline focuses on understanding behaviour, setting clear boundaries, and coaching children toward self-regulation.

questions.question: Are these strategies culturally appropriate for Hong Kong families?
questions.answer: Yes. We adapt Montessori principles to local lifestyles, including small homes, busy schedules, and helper-supported caregiving.

questions.question: Will this make my child too soft or less competitive?
questions.answer: Children raised with independence, emotional regulation, and responsibility often become more confident, focused, and resilient-not less capable.

questions.question: My child has tantrums, hits, or refuses to listen. Can Montessori help?
questions.answer: Yes, but not with quick fixes. We review environment, adult responses, routines, and developmental expectations, then give practical steps you can apply consistently.

questions.question: Does Montessori mean no discipline or letting children do anything?
questions.answer: No. Montessori discipline means clear limits, consistent routines, and calm leadership. Children thrive when freedom is paired with structure.

questions.question: Will I get practical tools or just theory?
questions.answer: You will get practical tools, including routines, behaviour scripts, environment checklists, and reflection sheets. We always turn principles into action.

questions.question: What if parents and helpers disagree on discipline?
questions.answer: This is very common. We align adults first so children receive consistent messages, expectations, and routines.

questions.question: My helper does not speak English fluently. Is that a problem?
questions.answer: No. Our method uses clear language, repetition, demonstrations, and visual guidance. The goal is understanding and consistency.

questions.question: Do you work directly with helpers?
questions.answer: Yes. We provide helper-friendly coaching, practical scripts, and routines aligned with family values.

questions.question: What services do you offer?
questions.answer: We offer consultation sessions, auntie training, home setup guidance, and parent support services tailored for families in Hong Kong.

questions.question: Do you offer packages or bundles?
questions.answer: Yes. Some families choose bundled support for deeper change. We recommend options after understanding your family needs.

questions.question: Why is this priced higher than a one-off parenting talk?
questions.answer: Because this is personalised and implementation-focused. You are paying for real-life observation, tailored guidance, and ongoing support-not just motivation.

questions.question: Is this just a one-time session or ongoing support?
questions.answer: Both options are available. Some families need a reset plan, while others benefit from longer support as children grow.

questions.question: Do you guarantee results?
questions.answer: Children are not machines, so no ethical professional guarantees instant perfection. What we do guarantee is clear guidance, practical strategy, and honest support.

questions.question: Is this backed by evidence?
questions.answer: Our work is informed by Montessori principles, child development research, and years of practical application with Hong Kong families and helpers.

questions.question: What makes Evolve Sprouts different from other parenting coaches?
questions.answer: We combine Montessori-informed guidance with deep understanding of Hong Kong family-helper dynamics. Our approach is practical, respectful, and non-judgmental.

questions.question: Is this suitable for international families in Hong Kong?
questions.answer: Yes. We regularly support multicultural families navigating different expectations around discipline, education, and caregiving.

questions.question: What if I am not sure which service I need?
questions.answer: That is normal. Reach out and we will help you choose the best starting point with no pressure.

questions.question: How do I get started?
questions.answer: Start with a consultation or contact us directly. We will guide you to the most suitable service for your family.

questions.question: Have not found what you need?
questions.answer: Get in touch-we are happy to help. Contact us through the Contact Us page.

termsAndConditions.title: Terms and Conditions
termsAndConditions.intro: These Terms and Conditions govern your use of the Evolve Sprouts website and services, including consultations, training, workshops, and digital resources.

sections.heading: 1. Acceptance of Terms
paragraphs: By accessing this website or booking a service, you agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions.
If you do not agree with these terms, please do not use the website or our services.

sections.heading: 2. Services and Eligibility
paragraphs: Evolve Sprouts provides Montessori-informed education and family support services for parents and caregivers.
You confirm that information submitted for booking and communication is accurate and complete.

sections.heading: 3. Booking, Payments, and Refunds
paragraphs: Bookings are only confirmed after payment has been received and acknowledged by Evolve Sprouts.
Any published refund windows, cancellation terms, and package inclusions apply as described at the time of booking.

sections.heading: 4. User Responsibilities
paragraphs: You agree not to misuse the website, submit unlawful content, or interfere with the security and availability of services.
You must not attempt unauthorized access to website systems, payment flows, or data.

sections.heading: 5. Intellectual Property
paragraphs: All website content, branding, course materials, and downloadable resources remain the property of Evolve Sprouts unless otherwise stated.
No content may be reproduced, redistributed, or commercially used without prior written permission.

sections.heading: 6. Liability and Disclaimers
paragraphs: Our services are educational and informational and do not replace medical, legal, psychological, or other regulated professional advice.
To the maximum extent permitted by law, Evolve Sprouts is not liable for indirect or consequential loss arising from use of the website or services.

sections.heading: 7. Governing Law and Jurisdiction
paragraphs: These Terms and Conditions are governed by the laws of Hong Kong.
Any dispute arising from these terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Hong Kong.

termsAndConditions.languagePrevailsClause: If there is any inconsistency between language versions of these Terms and Conditions, the English version prevails.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how Evolve Sprouts collects, uses, stores, and protects personal data provided through our website and services.

sections.heading: 1. Data We Collect
paragraphs: We may collect personal details you submit, such as your name, email address, phone number, booking information, and message content.
We may also collect technical usage data needed for security, analytics, and service reliability.

sections.heading: 2. How We Use Data
paragraphs: We use your data to respond to inquiries, process reservations, deliver services, and provide customer support.
Where permitted by law, we may also use contact information to send relevant service updates and communications.

sections.heading: 3. Legal Basis and Compliance
paragraphs: We process personal data in accordance with applicable Hong Kong privacy requirements, including the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (PDPO).
Where required, we obtain consent before collecting or processing personal information.

sections.heading: 4. Data Sharing and Processors
paragraphs: We do not sell personal data.
We may share data with trusted service providers (such as payment, form security, and hosting providers) strictly for operational purposes under appropriate safeguards.

sections.heading: 5. Data Retention and Security
paragraphs: We retain personal data only for as long as reasonably necessary for service delivery, legal obligations, and legitimate business needs.
We maintain technical and organizational safeguards to protect personal data against unauthorized access, disclosure, or loss.

sections.heading: 6. Your Rights
paragraphs: Subject to applicable law, you may request access to and correction of your personal data held by us.
You may also contact us to withdraw consent for specific data uses where consent is the legal basis.

sections.heading: 7. Contact
paragraphs: For privacy-related requests, please contact Evolve Sprouts through the Contact Us page.
